results.title: To my dearest son Mileak
results.creator_credit: Natasha Craig, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Even though Natasha Craig was pregnant at age 15, she was determined to have her child and embrace her new life as a mother. With the support of her family, she has been able to do so and doesn’t regret her decision as she sets up her life for her and her son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Natasha Craig, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Sky
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From the height of the Rockies on the rim of the western plains, the film catches and condenses the astounding spectacle of a day in the life of the sky. Photographed with many kinds of lenses and at different camera speeds, the result is a cinematographic experience of rare beauty - every changing mood of the sky is vividly registered. Film without words.

results.title: My little angel
results.creator_credit: Chris Mansfield, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Chris Mansfield introduces his daughter to the family she is about to be born into. A big family with a diverse Indigenous history, Mansfield is looking forward to his new responsibility.

results.title: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson, VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.

results.title: Sleep my love
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ralph Cohn, Charles Rogers, Mary Pickford and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: In this noir mystery thriller, a wealthy heiress (Claudette Colbert) wakes up hysterical on board a train from New York to Boston with no idea how she got there. When she contacts her husband (Don Ameche), he informs her that she disappeared after threatening him with a gun. On her return he urges her to visit an eminent psychiatrist. Soon it becomes clear that her apparently loving husband is in fact plotting to drive her to insanity then kill her and collect her fortune. Though dismissed by Sirk himself, this is a tautly paced thriller, with Joseph Valentine’s expressionist photography giving rise to a suitably nightmarish evocation of insanity and shifting appearances. Cast also includes Robert Cummings, Rita Johnson and George Coulouris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas Sirk, Ralph Cohn, Charles Rogers, Mary Pickford and Triangle Productions

results.title: Slave hunter = Rancheador
results.creator_credit: Sergio Giral and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: Against the historic backdrop of the colonial slave era in the Caribbean and other parts of Latin America, the figure of the Rancheador (slave hunter) appeared as one of the most abominable exponents of the system. The Rancheador, the mercenary of his era, was in charge of hunting down runaway slaves, the cimarrones, and returning them to their owners, or if the hunt ended in death, bringing back the slave’s ear. Francisco Estevez, one of the bloodiest and most ambitious slave hunters in Cuban history, was hired by the rich landowners to police the interests of absentee sugar growers. This film is based on the diary of Estevez himself, who not only hunted down the runaway slaves in their palenques (communities concealed in the hills, made up of runaway slaves), but also used his henchmen to repress all outbursts of rebellion or desire for freedom of those either white or black, free or slave. ‘Rancheador’ is the second film of Giral’s Slave Trilogy that also includes ‘The Other Francisco’ (1974) and ‘Maluala’ (1979). Adapted from ‘Diary of a Rancheador’ by Villaverde. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Slaughterhouse five
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Paul Monash and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Kurt Vonnegut, an American P.O.W. is slipping into mental illness. Now a suburban optometrist, he has space/time fantasies, shifting between his experiences as a POW, including the bombing of Dresden, his life on another planet and his actual life. Michael Sacks plays Billy Pilgrim in a film shot in Czechoslovakia and Minnesota, which captures the complexity of Vonnegut’s work, and the despair of mental illness

results.title: Slate, Wyn and Me
results.creator_credit: Don McLennan, Tom Burstall and Ukiyo Films
results.brief_description: Having robbed a bank and killed a policeman, two brothers kidnap a girl who witnessed it all. Based on the novel, ” Slate and me and Blanche McBride” by Georgia Savage. Stars Sigrid Thornton, Simon Burke and Martin Sacks.

results.title: Sladke hry minuleho leta = Sweet games of last summer
results.brief_description:
This impressionistic adaptation of De Maupassant’s classic novel ‘Mouche’ about a laundress and her five suitors was made for Czech television. Slovak-born director Juraj Herz has a career in film and television that spans more than 35 years and 30 films, working mainly in Prague but also in Slovakia, Germany and France. Although he first came to prominence in the 1960s, his work stands apart from that of other Czech and Slovak New Wave directors in its willingness to cross genres and constitutes a dense exploration of the fantastic.

Credits: Director, Juraj Herz ; photography, Jozef Simoncic.
Cast: Jana Plichtova, Frantisek Velecky, Peter Debnar, Milan Lasica, Julius Satinsky and Lubor Zahon.
